org.remoteHome

Class BlindsControllerDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.remoteHome.AbstractDevice
      • org.remoteHome.BlindsControllerDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<AbstractDevice>

    public class BlindsControllerDevice
extends AbstractDevice
implements java.io.Serializable
    Blinds controller

    pn - check weather the device is up and runing (ping command)
    s - return status 5|down|up|timeout value|current opening
       down - 1 if currently moving down
       up - 1 if currently moving up
       timeout value - number of configured timeout in sec. This value is the 100 % time to open the blinds
       current opening - Blinds opening in %. 0 means fully open, 100 means fully closed. In manual mode always 0.

    Position managed mode:

    bt=nnn - configure number of seconds, when the blind is moving fully from open position to closed position.
    bu - blinds up moving to fully open position
    bd - blinds down moving to fully closed position
    bs - blinds stop stop movements
    bm=nnn - Move to the nnn position. nnn is the percentage between open and close. 0 - fully open, 100 - fully closed

    Asynchronous messages: l|nnn percentage of opening.

    Manual mode:

    u - start to move up
    d - start to move down
    e - stop to move


    Quick startup:
    1. Connect wires
    2. Test the communication AT+0=pn
    3. Assign the device ID: AT+a=9 Id is 9.
    4. Measure the number of seconds from fully open position to fully closed position.
    5. Set this value to device: AT+9=bm=123
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        protected BlindsControllerDevice(RemoteHomeManager m,
                      int deviceId,
                      java.lang.String deviceName)

        Parameters:
        m - remote manager reference
        deviceId - deviceId assigned to this device
        deviceName - device name

      • updateDevice

        public void updateDevice()
                  throws RemoteHomeConnectionException,
                         RemoteHomeManagerException
        This method will update the values in this object from the hardware device
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with communication
        RemoteHomeManagerException - if the type of the device doesn't belongs to the answer received back.

      • configureFullRangeTimeout

        public void configureFullRangeTimeout(int fullRangeTimeout)
                               throws RemoteHomeConnectionException,
                                      RemoteHomeManagerException
        Parameters:
        fullRangeTimeout - timeout in seconds to move from fully open position to fully closed position
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with the connection
        RemoteHomeManagerException - if the range is outside 0 - 255 seconds

        public void moveBlindsToPosition(int position)
                          throws RemoteHomeConnectionException,
                                 RemoteHomeManagerException
        This method will move the blinds to predefined position
        Parameters:
        position - is the expected position in percents
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with the connection
        RemoteHomeManagerException - if the value is not in range 0 - 100

      • stopBlindsMovement

        public void stopBlindsMovement()
                        throws RemoteHomeConnectionException
        This method will stop the movement of the blinds
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with the connection

      • manualMoveUp

        public void manualMoveUp()
                  throws RemoteHomeConnectionException
        Don't use this method!!! Only for your own risk!!! Use rather blindsUp(). It is only for someone, who want to implement it's own logic. In this manual mode, the device will lost control about the position!!!!. Also the device will not stop the blinds!!!! So it is your responsibility to call manualStop!!!!
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with the connection

      • manualMoveDown

        public void manualMoveDown()
                    throws RemoteHomeConnectionException
        Don't use this method!!! Only for your own risk!!! Use rather blindsDown(). It is only for someone, who want to implement it's own logic. In this manual mode, the device will lost control about the position!!!!. Also the device will not stop the blinds!!!! So it is your responsibility to call manualStop!!!!
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with the connection

      • manualStop

        public void manualStop()
                throws RemoteHomeConnectionException
        Don't use this method!!! Only for your own risk!!! Use rather stopBlindsMovement(). It is only for someone, who want to implement it's own logic. In this manual mode, the device will lost control about the position!!!!. Also the device will not stop the blinds!!!! So it is your responsibility to call manualMoveStop!!!!
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with the connection

      • getBlindsControllerListener

        public BlindsControllerListener getBlindsControllerListener()
        This listenner listen for the event, when the blind is moved to required position. The user of this API should implement this interface and register it for that event.
        Returns:
        the blindsControllerListener
